contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract nouns "knowledge" and "insight" can be expressed as the verbs "learn" and "understand." AT: "God gave them the ability to learn and understand clearly in" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: God gave them knowledge and insight

contextId.information: Being ashamed is spoken of as if "shame" were an object that belongs to people. The abstract noun "shame" can be stated as a verb. AT: "But as for us, we are ashamed of what we have done—the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: To us today, however, belongs shame on our faces—for the people

contextId.information: These three activities are expressed here as if they were things. However, they may be expressed as actions, either in passive form or in active form. AT: "they will be refined, cleansed, and purified" or "their suffering will refine, cleanse, and purify them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: refining will happen to them, and cleansing, and purifying

contextId.information: The abstract noun "rage" can be expressed with the word "angry." It can be stated clearly that he would go out with his army. AT: "he will be very angry and will go out" or "he will become very angry and will go out with his army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he will go out with great rage
